page.title: 14EDUCATION IN NETHERBURY
page.content: There are 2 schools in this area both run by the local education authority. However, children who live in Netherbury and are of primary school age are taken by bus to a school outside our area. St. Mary's Primary School is a C.of E. V.C. school for l22 pupils with a headmaster and 4 teachers. It has a special unit for slow learners who come from as far afield as Lyme Regis. Beaminster Comprehensive serves a wide catchment area and has two boarding houses. There are 578 pupils with 43 teachers. Pupils between the ages of ll and l8 have access to a wide range of subjects; facilities for 6th formers are available at Beaminster or Colfox School in Bridport. The school swimming pool is used by the local swimming club and a wide variety of evening classes are well supported.
